alert.note: Alert for Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 10:09AM EDT until May 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Rabun County in northeast Georgia and Macon County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 AM EDT, Flooding of low-lying areas is expected to linger into the afternoon hours. This is especially true along the Little Tennessee at Needmore Rd and the Nantahala River near Tate Cove, Water Gage and Rainbow Springs Rd. In Rabun County, along the North Georgia Power projects, high levels of runoff will continue. Flooding of low lying areas from around Lake Burton downstream is possible. This is especially true along Mathis Dam Road and Shady Lane. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
